issue.title: no-global-function-names does not allow using CSS round function

repository.name: stylelint-scss
repository.description: A collection of SCSS specific linting rules for Stylelint

issue.body:
When the CSS `round` function is used, the `scss/no-global-function-names` rule reports an error.

More information:
* https://developer.mozilla.org/de/docs/Web/CSS/round
* https://drafts.csswg.org/css-values/#funcdef-round

body: It looks like Chrome supports this now.

issue.title: Add tests for `round()` with no modulus

repository.name: dart-sass
repository.description: The reference implementation of Sass, written in Dart.

issue.title: Specify support for CSS `round()` with a single unitless argument
issue.body:
This is a fast-track proposal.

Closes #3803

issue.title: Add tests for CSS `round()` with one argument
issue.body:
This also updates tests expect global function warnings when
calculations are falling back on global Sass functions.

See sass/sass#3803
Closes #2036

[skip dart-sass]

issue.title: Add support for CSS `round()` with one unitless argument

repository.name: dart-sass
repository.description: The reference implementation of Sass, written in Dart.

issue.body:
This also adds deprecation warnings for cases where a CSS calculation
is determined to need to mimic a global Sass function, to match the
global Sass function deprecation.

See sass/sass#3803
Closes #2433

See sass/sass-spec#2037
